content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica, Rachel, Ross, and Phoebe are there. Phoebe is looking out the window.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh. Ugly Naked Guy is decorating his tree. Oh my God, you should see the size of his Christmas Balls.
[Chandler and Joey enter.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how much did you guys tip the super this year?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we were gonna give fifty, but if you guys gave more, we don’t wanna look bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, actually this year we just made him homemade cookies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And twenty-five it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You gave him cookies?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Money is so impersonal. Cookies says someone really cares… Alright, we’re broke, but cookies do say that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can see that. A plate of brownies once told me a limerick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebs, let me ask you something, were, were these, uh, funny brownies?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not especially. But you know what, I think they had pot in them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you guys, who else did you tip with cookies?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, the mailman, the super.
[There’s a bang at the door.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, and the newspaper delivery guy.
[Joey opens the door and picks up the remnants of the newspaper.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhh, I don’t think you’re gonna like this.
[Joey shows them the torn-up newspaper.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, goooosh, ooh, these are cookies smashed in the sports section.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh look, and he did my crossword puzzle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but not very well, unless 14-across, ‘Gershwin musical’ actually is bitemebitemebitemebiteme.

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk. Monica, Chandler, and Joey are seated at couches. Rachel is working behind the counter.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe it’s Christmas already. Ya know, I mean, one day your eatin’ turkey, the next thing ya know, your lords are a-leapin’ and you geese are a-layin’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which is why geese are so relaxed this time of year.
[Ross enters with several bags from shopping.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys.
Chandler, Monica, and Joey: Hey.
[Ross approaches Rachel at counter.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Rach. I, uh, got you a little present. [Rachel is not impressed]. . I’ll open it. It’s a Slinky! Remember, huh. [sings] Walks down stairs, alone or in pairs, everyone knows it’s … just a big spring. Alright, you still mad at me becuase of the whole…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Horrible and degrading list of reasons not to be with me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How ‘bout from now on we just call it the ‘unfortunate incident’? [Rachel walks off] Hey Gunther, you got stairs in your place?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here, go nuts. [gives him the Slinky and goes and sits with others at the couches]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: Chandler, Monica, and Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s in the bag?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, just some presents.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon show us what you bought… You know you want to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [childishly] OK. OK, this is a picture frame from Ben to my parents, huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cute.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got some, uh, hers and hers towels for Susan and Carol. And, uh, I got this blouse for mom.
[Ross holds up the blouse. It is extremely tacky, with sewn-on medals hanging off of it.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, that is gorgeous!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at these authentic fake medals. I tell ya, mom’s gonna be voted best dressed at the make-believe military academy.
[Phoebe enters.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Gang
content.text: Hey. Hi Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy Christmas Eve Eve. [sees Ross’s picture frame] Oh my God, where did you get this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Macy’s, third floor, home furnishings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is my father, this is a picture of my dad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nah, Phoebs, that’s the guy that comes in the frame.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No it isn’t, this is my dad, alright, I’ll show you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, I thought your dad was in prison.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, that’s my stepdad. My real dad’s the one that ran out on us before I was born.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How have you never been on Oprah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [showing her pictures] OK, look, see, this is him. My mother gave me this picture before she died, same guy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, uh, this is a picture of the frame guy posing in front of a bright blue screen with a collie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not a blue screen… it’s just, maybe it was just really clear that day. OK, I have to talk to my grandmother. [turns to leave]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, wait a minute honey.

content.speaker: Gang
content.text: Phoebs. [Phoebe leaves]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So anyway, I’m trying to get my boss’s ex-wife to sleep with me…

content.speaker: Gang
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, but when Phoebe has a problem, everyone’s all ears!

content.description: Phoebe’s grandmother’s place. Phoebe’s grandmother is sitting at the table, reading the obituaries, and crossing out names in the phonebook.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Esther Livingston. [scratches out name] Gone.
[Phoebe enters.]

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Hi, Phoe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Gram. Whatcha doin’?

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Oh, just updating the phonebook.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, gram, um, can I see the pictures of my dad again?

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: [nervously] Oh. Oh, sure, sure, uh, uh, how come?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just, you know, to see… um.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Oh, sure, yeah. [gets a box with the pictures] This is the one of you father in a meadow, and, uh, helping a little boy fly a kite, and here he is at a graduation… another graduation… another graduation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, is this really my father?

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Is it really your fa—I can’t… well of course it is.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, I smell smoke. Maybe that’s ’cause someone’s pants are on fire.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Look, I…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ya know, in all the years that we have been grandmother and granddaughter, you have never lied to me.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Alright, that is not your father, that’s just a picture of a guy in a frame.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: It was your mother’s idea. Ya know, she didn’t want you to know your real father because it hurt her so much when he left, and, I didn’t want to go along with it, but, well then she died and, and it was harder to argue with her. Not impossible, but harder.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, so, what, he’s not a famous tree surgeon? And then, I guess, OK, he doesn’t live in a hut in Burma where there’s no phones?

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Last I heard, he was a pharmacist somewhere upstate.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, that makes no sense. Why would the villagers worship a pharmacist?

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Honey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [realizes] Oh.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Anyway, that’s all I know. That, and this. [pulls apart a frame and pulls a picture out] This is the real him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Rachel, Chandler, and Joey are decorating the Christmas tree.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know I remember my father, all dressed up in the red suit, the big black boots, and the patent leather belt, sneakin around downstairs. He didn’t want anybody to see him but he’d be drunk so he’d stumble, crash into something and wake everybody up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that doesn’t sound like a very merry Christmas.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who said anything about Christmas?
[Monica and Ross enter.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, anyone hear from Phoebe yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, nothin’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hope she’s OK.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I know exactly what she’s goin’ through.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do you know exactly what she’s going through?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She told us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So whaddya got there Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just some stuff for the party.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, what’re you guys doin’ here, aren’t you supposed to be Christmas shopping?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You guys haven’t gotten your presents yet? Tomorrow’s Christmas Eve, what’re ya gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t you have to be Claymation to say stuff like that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, by the way Mon, I don’t think the mailman liked your cookies. Here are the ornaments your mom sent. [hands her a smashed box]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, maybe the mailman liked the cookies, we just didn’t give him enough.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica, pigeons learn faster that you.
[Ross approaches Rachel, away from everyone else.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Rach, you know what? I think, I think I know what’ll make you feel better. How ‘bout you make a list about me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wha… forget it Ross, no, I am not gonna stand here and make a list of…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, you’re whiney, you are, you’re obsessive, you are insecure, you’re, you’re gutless, you know, you don’t ever, you don’t just sort of seize the day, you know. You like me for what, a year, you didn’t do anything about it. And, uh, oh, you wear too much of that gel in your hair.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See there, you uhh, alright, ya, you did what I said.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and you know what? You’re right, I do feel better, thank you Ross. [she walks off and Ross puts his hand to his hair]

content.description: Back at Phoebe’s. She is on the phone

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, um, in Albany, can I have the number of Frank Buffay… OK, um, in Ithica… alright, um, Saratoga… Oneonta. Alright, you know what, you shouldn’t call youself information. [hangs up]
[Phoebe’s grandmother enters]

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello grandma, if that is in fact your real name.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: C’mon now Phoe, don’t still be mad at me. How’s it going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, not so good. Upstate’s pretty big, he’s pretty small, you do the math.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Well, I think you’re better off without him. Oh honey, I know he’s your daddy but, but to me he’s still the irresponsible creep who knocked up your mom and stole her Gremlin.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I just, just wanted to know who he was, ya know.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: I know. OK, I wasn’t completely honest with you when I told you that, uh, I didn’t know exactly where he lived.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whattaya mean?

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: He lives at 74 Laurel Drive in Middletown. If you hit the Dairy Queen, you’ve gone too far. You can take my cab.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow. Thank you.

content.speaker: Grandmother
content.text: Now, remember, nobody else drives that cab.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, got it. Ooh, I’m gonna see my dad. Wish me luck, Grandpa! [blows a kiss to a picture of Einstein]

content.description: Chandler is standing on a street corner waiting for Phoebe in the cab. Joey walks up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe here with the cab yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, she, she brought the invisible cab… hop in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well she better get here soon, the outlet stores close at 7.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, don’t worry. I figure it’ll be 2 hours to Phoebe’s dad’s house, they’ll meet, they’ll chat, they’ll swap life stories, we’ll still have plenty of time.
[Phoebe drives up in the cab]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, here she comes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.
[Phoebe runs over the curb. Joey gets in the back seat, Chandler in the front]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can you believe this. In, like, two hours I’m gonna have a dad. Eeeshk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eeeshk.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, big stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, let’s go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, here, you have to hold this. [hands Chandler a piece of paper]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK. [reads paper] Brake left, gas right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah, that’s my cheat sheet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [grabs for seat belt] Where’s my seat belt?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no no, that side doesn’t have one, the paramedics had to cut through it. [Chandler jumps out of the car]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [Chandler gets in the back seat] Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. [Phoebe takes off, Joey and Chandler are thrown back in the seat]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica is preparing for the party with Ross questioning her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, just tell me, please, please.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: For the sixteenth time, no… I do not think you’re obsessive.
[Rachel enters from her room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, gosh, it’s hot in here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, get the heat. [Rachel holds up her hand with wet fingernail polish] Ross, could you turn the heat down please?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. By the way, there’s a difference between being obsessive and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, the heat!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, OK! Heat, heat, heat, and I’m the obsessive one. [goes to the radiator and starts turning the knob] OK, this way is on, so this is… [breaks off the knob] off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you just break the radiator?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, I was turnin’ the knob and, and… here it is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well put it back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It uhh, it won’t go back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll call the super.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here, let me try.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh that’s right, I forgot about your ability to fuse metal.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, it’s Funny’s cousin, Not Funny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [on phone] Hi, Mr. Treeger. Hi, it’s Rachel Green from upstairs. Yes, somebody , uh, broke our knob on the radiator and it’s really hot in here. Yes, it’s, it’s hot enough to bake cookies. Well, do you think we could have a new one by 6? Wha t, no, no, Tuesday, we can’t wait until Tuesday, we’re having a party tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, tip the man.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, if he doesn’t like our cookies, too bad, I am not gonna be blackmailed. Look if worse comes to worse, it gets a little warm, we’ll call it a theme party.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, here’s a theme: Come on in, live like bacon.

content.description: Outside Phoebe’s dad’s house. The cab pulls up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, this is it, 74. [screeches to a halt, Joey and Chandler are thrown into the plexiglass wall in the cab]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so that’s what this is for.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, this is it, I’m gonna meet my dad. This is like the biggest thing ever, huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure is.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, here I go. I’m goin’ in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good luck Phoebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, here I go… here I go… I’m goin’. [she just sits in the cab]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. They are having their party. All the guests are stripped down because of the heat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [answers door] Hi, welcome to our tropical Christmas party. You can put your coats and sweaters and pants and shirts in the bedroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [sitting at table talking to a girl] It’s hard to tell because I’m sweating, but I use exactly what the gel bottle says, an amount about the size of a pea. How, how can that be too much?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [carrying an ice cube tray] Ice, ice, ice squares anyone? Take a napkin. Alright.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, Monica, your guest are turning into jerky, OK.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? I’m perfectly comfortable. [one of the guest opens the refrigerator] Hey, hey, hey, get in line buddy, I was next. [she opens the refrigerator and leans into it]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [answering the door] Mr. Treeger.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Uhh, you said there was a party.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, well hey, welcome to our sauna.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Ahh, is it hot? My body always stays cool, probably ’cause I have so much skin. Hey, cheese!
[Ross is speaking to Monica and Rachel about tipping the super.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, alright, here’s the chance. Monica give him cash, Rachel give him your earrings. Something, now, anything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I will not cave.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m with Mon.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, alright, you know how you say I never seize the day? Well, alright, even though he’s your super, I’m seizing. [approaches Mr. Treeger] Mr. Treeger, here is 50 bucks, merry Christmas.
[Gives him the cash.]

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Oh wow, I didn’t get you anything. Here’s five back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no, no, that, that’s your Christmas tip, alright. Oh, hey, do you think there’s a chance you could fix that radiator now?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: No can do, like I told the girl, I can’t get a new knob until Thursday.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [to Ross] Looks like he’s playin’ baseball.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You mean hardball?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whatever.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’cha gonna’ do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me, I’m seizing. Mr. Treeger, here’s another 50, happy Hanukkah. Will uh, will this help with the knob getting?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: No, the place is not open ’till Tuesday. Am I not saying it right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, wait, you really did like my cookies?

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Oh, yeah, they were so personal, really showed you cared.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nice seizing… gel boy.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: [to Rachel who is standing under mistletoe] So, uh, is this, uh, mistletoe?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh-huh, no act—no, uhh, that, that is basil.

content.speaker: Mr. Treeger
content.text: Ahh, if it was mistletoe, I was gonna kiss ya.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh-hoo, yeah, no, it’s still basil.

content.description: Outside Phoebe’s dad’s house. Phoebe is running back to the cab.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How far’d ya get?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mailbox.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, we’re gettin’ closer.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebs, what’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s just like, ya know, it’s a whole mess of stuff, ya know. It’s like, yesterday, ya know, my dad was this, like, famous Burma tree surgeon guy and, ya know, now he’s a, a pharmacist guy and…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, maybe he’s, maybe he’s this really cool pharmacist guy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, maybe, yeah. You know, and, and I’ll knock on the door and, and he’ll hug me and I’ll have a dad. Ya know and I’ll, I’ll go to his pharmacy and everyone will be really nice to me ’cause, you know, I’m Franks daughter.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, so why not go knock?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, ’cause, I mean, what if, what if he’s not this great dad guy? I mean, what if, what if he’s just still the dirtbag who ran out on my mom and us? You know what? I’ve already lost a fake dad this week and I don’t think I’m ready to lose a real one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebs, that’s OK. You took a big step today.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, and someday when you’re ready, you’ll make it past the hedges.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and when you do, he’ll be lucky to have you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys. I’m sorry about your shopping.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s OK, we’ll figure something out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, listen Phoebs, I know you’re not goin’ in there but do you think it’d be alright if I went in and used his bathroom? Oh, that’s fine, never mind. Cool, snow, kinda like a blank canvas.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Ross, Monica, and Rachel are sitting around after the party. Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe enter.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ho, ho, ho, holy crap is it hot in here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really, hey, you mind if I turn the heat down?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, we could have used that kind of thinkin’ earlier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Phoebs, how’d it go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I couldn’t go in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you OK?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah, no it’s OK ’cause, I mean, I know he’s there, so, that’s enough for now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, guys, it’s after midnight, merry Christmas everyone. [Ross and Phoebe hug, Monica and Rachel hug, Chandler is left standing]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Monica, the knob was broken so I just turned it off from underneath, I hope that’s alright.
Closing Titles

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Joey and Chandler are giving out their Christmas presents out of a cardboard box from a case of motor oil.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach, these are for you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wiper blades. I don’t even have a car.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, but with this new car smell, you’ll think you do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, Phoebs, your turn.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ahh, toilet seat covers! Is that what you were doing while I was getting gas?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guuuyys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And for Ross, Mr. Sweet-tooth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got me a cola drink?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And, a lemon lime.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well this, this is too much, I feel like I should get you another sweater.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And last but not least.
[Chandler and Joey give Monica a pack of condoms.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They’re ribbed for your pleasure.
[Ross and Monica trade their gifts.]
